Title.evidence: COMPARACIÓN DE LA LIGADURA CON BANDA ELÁSTICA Y LA HEMORROIDECTOMÍA EN PACIENTES CON HEMORROIDES SINTOMÁTICAS GRADO III: ENSAYO MULTICÉNTRICO, ABIERTO, ALEATORIZADO, CONTROLADO Y DE NO INFERIORIDAD

Trial_Design.evidence: Open-label, parallel-group, randomized controlled noninferiority trial.

Participants.evidence: Patients (aged 18 years or older) with symptomatic grade III (Goligher) hemorrhoids were included in this study.

Intervention.evidence: Randomized 1:1 to rubber band ligation or hemorrhoidectomy, with up to 2 banding sessions allowed.

Objective.evidence: To directly compare the effectiveness of rubber band ligation and hemorrhoidectomy in the treatment of grade III hemorrhoids.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcomes included 12-month health-related quality of life and recurrence rate.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Eighty-seven patients were randomly assigned (47 rubber band ligation vs 40 hemorrhoidectomy).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Eighty-seven patients were randomly assigned (47 rubber band ligation vs 40 hemorrhoidectomy).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Rubber band ligation was not noninferior to hemorrhoidectomy in quality-adjusted life years (–0.045; 95% CI, –0.087 to –0.004).
